Subject: Re: [junit] Proposed parameterized test syntax for JUnit 4

David Saff wrote:
> All,
> 
> Kent and I thought and coded last night about a mechanism for allowing
> parameterized test cases in JUnit 4.  The results are in the Version4
> branch of CVS.   We'd appreciate your feedback.  For a glimpse of the
> mechanism in action, see org.junit.tests.ParameterizedTestTest.java:
> 
> *http://tinyurl.com/7lyoh

I like the general idea. I'd like to see the input and the expected 
output to be more obviously marked as such. Perhaps we could have one 
convenience version where instead of @Parameter(0) we have @Input and 
for @Parameter(1) we have @ExpectedResult. It's just a question of 
revealing intent.

Otherwise, I love it. It makes me not want to do it in Fit.

(And now that I have Tiger, I can actually try it out!)
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
